Package org.thedryden.workmanager

Class WorkerPool

java.lang.Object
org.thedryden.workmanager.WorkerPool
public class WorkerPool
extends java.lang.Object
WorkerPool is designed for easily setting up a multi-threaded, but static, operations that include a number of features to make managing the entire process easier. When working with WorkerPool there are 2 key concepts to keep in mind: pools and workers. A pool is a collection of workers. When a pool is started up to the max thread count of workers in the pool will be started. If there are some workers in the pool that must wait for the completion of one or more other workers in the pool before they can safely be started you can set a precedence constraint on that worker. Precedence Constraints are simple a list of thread names (Strings) of the other "parent" workers that the "child" worker needs to wait for. If a parent worker fails, the child worker will not be started. Finally you can have more than one pool, allowing you to create larger logical blocks of code that will run in sequence. Workers are objects that once started will do the actual work. To create a worker simply create your own class that extends the worker class Worker. That class has all of the required methods implemented, except, the worker method, which you will need to overwrite and implement with your own code. The worker method expects critical errors to be thrown, where they will be caught by the class you extended, and the status will be updated to failed automatically. Therefore you should only catch errors if they do not represent the class failing and you want your the code in that class to continue executing. Remember that even if one worker fails, by default, all other workers in the pool will still run, and any other pools will still execute, that behavior is controlled by stopAllRunningOnFailure and dontStartNextPoolOnFailure respectively.
Author:
Matthew Dryden

    Starts all pools at the same time asynchronously.

    Starts the passed pool.

    Starts the passed pool, without blocking until completion.

    Starts the passed pools, running them one at a time in the order they were passed - not added.

    Starts the passed pools, without blocking until completion.
    WorkerPool startPoolsAsyncAndJoin​(java.lang.String... poolNames)
    Used to start multiple pool asynchronous, but then wait for all pools to complete before continuing.

    • setStartNextPoolOnFailure

      public WorkerPool setStartNextPoolOnFailure​(boolean startNextPoolOnFailure)
      Used to set the value for the property: start next pool on failure. When this is false and either start or startPools is called they will not start the next pool if the previous pool failed. If this is true, then the next pool will start regardless of the status of the last pool.
      Parameters:
      startNextPoolOnFailure - the new value for don't start next pool on failure.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.

    • isExitOnError

      public boolean isExitOnError()
      If true when start, startPools, startAsyncAndJoin, or startOnePool is called at the end of execution of all pools, if the aggregate status for all pools is failure then start will cause System.exit(-1) to be called. If false do nothing
      Returns:
      the value for exitOnError

    • setExitOnError

      public WorkerPool setExitOnError​(boolean exitOnError)
      Used to set exitOnError. If true when start, startPools, startAsyncAndJoin, or startOnePool is called at the end of execution of all pools, if the aggregate status for all pools is failure then start will cause System.exit(-1) to be called.
      Parameters:
      exitOnError - the value you wish to set for exit on error
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining

    • addPool

      public WorkerPool addPool​(java.lang.String poolName)

      Parameters:

    • setRetry

      public WorkerPool setRetry​(int retryAttempts, int retryWaitSeconds, boolean rerunSuccess)
      For the last pool added sets a number of retry to attempt on a failure and the number of seconds to wait before after a failure before the retry.
      Parameters:
      retryAttempts - the number of times you wish to retry the pool in the even of a failure
      retryWaitSeconds - the number of seconds to wait after a failure before you retry.
      rerunSuccess - if true all workers will be rerun. If false then any workers that already completed with status success will be skipped.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining

    • setRetry

      Parameters:

      retryAttempts - the number of times you wish to retry the pool in the even of a failure
      retryWaitSeconds - the number of seconds to wait after a failure before you retry.
      rerunSuccess - if true all workers will be rerun. If false then any workers that already completed with status success will be skipped.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining

    • setNotInAll

      public WorkerPool setNotInAll()
      Sets the last worker added with either the addWorker method to the Not In All list. Workers in the Not In All pool will not be run if ALL arg is passed as the runArg, or no runArg is passed at all. To run these you must explicitly add the name of the name of the worker to the runArg.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.

    • setNotInAll

      public WorkerPool setNotInAll​(java.lang.String workerThreadName)
      Takes a worker's thread name and adds it to the Not In All list. Workers in the Not In All pool will not be run if ALL arg is passed as the runArg, or no runArg is passed at all. To run these you must explicitly add the name of the name of the worker to the runArg.
      Parameters:
      workerThreadName - a threadName to add to the Not In All List
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.

    • setRunArg

      public WorkerPool setRunArg​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> runArg)
      Used to control which pools / workers will run. The concept behind this is that when this package is called the user will be able to provide a argument to control what will and will not run in this package. If all is passed everything in the package, not market as "notInAll" will run. If a pool name is passed everything that will act like you passed the name of all workers in that pool. If you put a minus (-) in front of a worker / pool name than that worker / pool will be removed from execution.
      Parameters:
      runArg - a list of pool / worker names.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.

    • setRunArg

      public WorkerPool setRunArg​(java.lang.String[] runArg)
      Used to control which pools / workers will run. The concept behind this is that when this package is called the user will be able to provide a argument to control what will and will not run in this package. If all is passed everything in the package, not market as "notInAll" will run. If a pool name is passed everything that will act like you passed the name of all workers in that pool. If you put a minus (-) in front of a worker / pool name than that worker / pool will be removed from execution.
      Parameters:
      runArg - a list of pool / worker names.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.

    • start

      public WorkerPool start() throws java.lang.InterruptedException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException, AlreadyRunningException
      Starts all pools in the order they were added.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start

    • startAsync

      public WorkerPool startAsync() throws AlreadyRunningException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException
      Starts all pools at the same time asynchronously. Does not support startNextPoolOnFailure = false, since all pools are started at the same time. Note this does not block execution until it completes for that use startAsyncAndJoin
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.
      Throws:
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start

    • startAsyncAndJoin

      public WorkerPool startAsyncAndJoin() throws AlreadyRunningException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Starts all pools at the same time asynchronously and then blocks execution until they complete. Does not support startNextPoolOnFailure = false, since all pools are started at the same time.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.

    • startOnePool

      public WorkerPool startOnePool​(java.lang.String poolName) throws java.lang.InterruptedException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException, AlreadyRunningException
      Starts the passed pool. Once completed this pool will be removed from the list of pools that will be started with the start method.
      Parameters:
      poolName - The name of the pool of workers you wish to run
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start

    • startPools

      public WorkerPool startPools​(java.lang.String... poolNames) throws DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException, java.lang.InterruptedException, AlreadyRunningException
      Starts the passed pools, running them one at a time in the order they were passed - not added. Once completed these pools will be removed from the list of pools that will be started with the start method.
      Parameters:
      poolNames - one or more poolName in a list or a array of poolNames
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start

    • startOnePoolAsync

      public WorkerPool startOnePoolAsync​(java.lang.String poolName) throws AlreadyRunningException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException
      Starts the passed pool, without blocking until completion. Once completed this pool will be removed from the list of pools that will be started with the start method.
      Parameters:
      poolName - The name of the pool of workers you wish to run
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining.
      Throws:
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start

    • startPoolsAsync

      public WorkerPool startPoolsAsync​(java.lang.String... poolNames) throws AlreadyRunningException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException
      Starts the passed pools, without blocking until completion. Once started a pool will be removed from the list of pools that will be started with the start method.
      Parameters:
      poolNames - one or more poolName in a list or a array of poolNames
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints

    • startPoolsAsyncAndJoin

      public WorkerPool startPoolsAsyncAndJoin​(java.lang.String... poolNames) throws AlreadyRunningException, DuplicateThreadNameException, CircularPrecedenceConstraintException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Used to start multiple pool asynchronous, but then wait for all pools to complete before continuing. This is just a convince function that calls startPoolAysnc followed by joinPools (with 0 from waitMilliseconds).
      Parameters:
      poolNames - one or more poolName in a list or a array of poolNames
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      AlreadyRunningException - thrown if a pool that is already running is asked to start
      DuplicateThreadNameException - thrown if any thread name is duplicated, even across pools
      CircularPrecedenceConstraintException - thrown if two workers both list each other as Precedence Constraints
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity.

    • joinPool

      public WorkerPool joinPool​(int waitMilliseconds, java.lang.String poolName) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Used in conjunction with any of Async methods to block execution until the passed poolName completes or waitMilliseconds elapses. If waitMilliseconds = 0 then it will wait forever for the execution to complete.
      Parameters:
      waitMilliseconds - the maximum time this will wait for execution to complete. Pass if you don't want a maximum time.
      poolName - The name of the pool you wish wait for.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown if the pool is still running after waitMilliseconds elapsed.

    • joinPools

      public WorkerPool joinPools​(int waitMilliseconds, java.lang.String... poolNames) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Used in conjunction with any of Async methods to block execution until the passed poolNames completes or waitMilliseconds elapses. If waitMilliseconds = 0 then it will wait forever for the execution to complete.
      Parameters:
      waitMilliseconds - the maximum time this will wait for execution to complete. Pass if you don't want a maximum time.
      poolNames - The name of the pools you wish wait for either as a list of parameters or a single array.
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - Thrown if the pool is still running after waitMilliseconds elapsed.

    • getStatus

      public Status getStatus​(java.lang.String poolName)
      Gets the composite status of an entire pool.
      Parameters:
      poolName - the name of the pool you want to check
      Returns:
      the composite status of the pool

    • getStatus

      public Status getStatus​(java.lang.String... poolNames)
      Gets the composite status of the passed pools.
      Parameters:
      poolNames - the name of the pools you want to check
      Returns:
      the composite status of the pools

    • getAllStatus

      public Status getAllStatus()
      Gets the composite status of all pools.
      Returns:
      The composite status of all pools.
